The camera will recognize the license plate and open the gate. For the pedestrian gate instead there is a code on the receipt ticket (not lose it) to access the area.

Ideal to spend the night if you are going on the highway. highly recommended

It has good access and has two picnic areas with shade. Only bad point that if it is very hot there is a bad smell because the purifier is next to it.

title: (02611) Lagunas de Ruidera - Unnamed Road
description: I slept here on August 29 and 30, in the morning I walked around the lagoons and had lunch in a local bar, all without any problems of fines or neighbors. There is no sign indicating that overnight stays are prohibited. In half an hour you are on the other side of the San Pedro lagoon on foot and you will see the Kayak rentals. In front of the Albamanjon hotel you have a wooden walkway and a bathroom area is a 5-minute walk from the overnight area that I indicated.

title: (02611) Ossa de Montiel - Calle Cañadillas

title_short: (45800) Quintanar de la Orden - 8 Avenida Anselmo Madero

title: () - N-310

title: (45810) Villanueva de Alcardete -

title: (02610) El Bonillo - CM-3133
description: Flat area with easy access from the road and trees for shade. Good place to stop en route or overnight in the middle of nature. Without services

title: (13248) Alhambra - 37 Grupo San Bartolomé A
description: We spent the night, quiet, and safely. a castle in ruins is easily accessible, ideal for getting there before continuing the road.

title: (16421) Puebla de Almenara - Unnamed Road
description: Recreation area "La Ermita", next to the path that goes up to the castle of Puebla de Almenara. There are numerous open fields around which you can park a large motorhome. I don't recommend the road that goes up to the antennas for very large vehicles.

title: (16421) Puebla de Almenara - Unnamed Road
description: Hermitage of the Virgin of Mercy in Puebla de Almenara. There is a rural house. It has public services (ask them to open). There is drinking water. And parking for vans and caravans (free). You can ask for the key and see the hermitage. From here, hiking and biking routes depart throughout the Jarameña mountain range. Also, you can see the Castle from the 14th century belonging to the order of Santiago with capital in Uclés. Sport, history, nature ... you can't ask for more. Greetings traveler
